display: make an investment banking technical interview prep website. it should have modules for: Accounting, Valuation, Enterprise value vs equity value, DCF, M&A, LBO. users should be able to click into each module which has options for review flashcards, randomly generated multiple choice quiz, and open ended questions where users can type answer to AI and get feedback. For the flashcards randomly generate 10 questions per round, for the quiz randomly generate 5 per round, and for the open ended question randomly generate 5. For now lets just make sure the functionalities work so we can do sample questions/placeholder questions. later on i will provide you with a comprehensive question bank to use. focus on the core functionalities of the website
whenever i click into any of the "choose your learning mode", whether that be flashcards, multiple choice quiz, or open ended practice i get the following error message "Module not found"
none of the back to module buttons work
is the ai actually working, what llm are you using?
i honestly like it, but in the ai feedback get rid of the **
yes make those changes
get rid of the "click on any module..."
can you make the website look more pretty, have a slick blue/white color schem. incorporate shadcn ui components, and can you add in cool effects and anything that enhances the ui/ux. ultrathink
the flashcards dont work, when i click to reveal the answer the answer card is like flipped from right to left reading its not legible, also as it flips theres too long of a delay

can we make a landing page home screen like githubs, where its super beautiful with IB or finance related landing page. then theres an arrow that pops up pointing down saying "start practicing" then as they scroll down it shows the various topics and pops up like github: https://github.com/

for the AI-powered interview prep part get rid of the star emoji thing in front of it. also just get rid of the view topics button. also i think theres too much margin/space on the top the start practicing arrow is cut off and i have to scroll to see it, shrink the margin at the top slightly

for this text "Practice technical questions, ace your case studies, and land your dream role at top investment banks with our comprehensive prep platform." replace it with "Practice technical questions and land your dream role at top investment banks with our comprehensive prep platform". Also get rid of "choose your focus area" and replace it with "Master technical interviews"

get rid of "master technical concepts across six core investment banking topics". also for the arrow just remove the start practicing text, and make it so if i click on the arrow it actually scrolls down. lastly, for the flashcard 3d things, make them unique they all say flashcard, it should say: master, interview, prep between the three. and rather than a Q for all of them do one Q, one graph, one money
now can you ensure that the page loads how we want it regardless of device the user accesses it on? like any dimensions their laptop is?

ok now when the user reloads the website, slow down the questions, core topics, and ai feedback counting, make it appear super fast but make it last longer, maybe loop it for a couple cycles even. when the user hovers over ready to ace your interview? make it then say get started for free
wait dont have a negative in front lmao. for the hovering over "ready to ace your interview?" make it so if they hover over it shades blue and then says get started for free.
ok now for the 6 modules the pages look ugly. again lets keep consistent with blue and white theme, make sure the page adjusts for all device types, make the UI/UX super nice for the user. ultrathink

ok the pages where we choose our learning mode are too big first of all, the text and blocks are. but i think we need to just change the layout and make it look better. can you do it like three boxes from left to right for the learning modes rather than rectangles stacked on top of eachother. also get rid of any emojis used anywhere like the star or the book emoji

ok lastly, when i click into the modules, and it then has the first letter capitalized, just get rid of that block, rather make the title better, come up with something that looks really cool, apply this to all the modules

ok now can we add a sales page, where if they click on "start practicing now" or get started for free, it takes them to a page with similar theme to website, basically make it a salesy page where maybe you load a price and then cross it out and list out a price half of it and say something like half off and then something like 1 week free trial on us, have a pay wall of 3 tiers. monthly for $20 but first time month $10. yearly for 100, actually do just two payment types monthly and yearly. for now just have these pages, eventually i will integrate stripe for actual payments

when they press the get started for free button it should also take them to the payment page. get rid of the block text of 7 day free trial, get rid of "start your free trial". make the pricing page like this but with our theme and two payment options: https://www.vibecodeapp.com/pricing

get rid of the "questions? email us at support@example.com" also can you make it so that makes the entire pricing fit without having to scroll, the sizing seems wonky right now. also remove the back to home button
for the monthly plan make the button blue like the yearly
ok now i need to implement actual user sign in and google auth, backend for storage, and stripe integration for payments, can you do this or do i have to do it in an ide environment

ok i will paste my supabase keys, can you then execute and tell me what to do: https://okrfjgiqpvvxyizusjnp.supabase.co and eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJzdXBhYmFzZSIsInJlZiI6Im9rcmZqZ2lxcHZ2eHlpenVzam5wIiwicm9sZSI6ImFub24iLCJpYXQiOjE3NjM3MDczNjYsImV4cCI6MjA3OTI4MzM2Nn0.5QwLphrP3BCJ-R2TrgYenzMuS_8dQ_XW7U2CGogGbjM
